javadoc.text: * A Gaussian process is a stochastic process whose realizations consist of * random values associated with every point in a range of times (or of space) * such that each such random variable has a normal distribution. Moreover, * every finite collection of those random variables has a multivariate normal * distribution. * A random field is a generalization of a stochastic process such that the * underlying parameter need no longer be a simple real or integer valued "time", * but can instead take values that are multidimensional vectors, or points on * some manifold. * This GaussianField class is a generalization, as well as the underlying * implementation, of {@linkplain GaussianProcess}. * Prior to calling {@linkplain #getDistribution(boolean,double)} you must call{@linkplain #addObservation(double,double)} one or more times.
javadoc.author: apete
